subject: Public Speaking
title: Kennedy's Ich Bin Ein Berliner
description: A short lesson to help you apply Kennedy's Ich Bin Ein Berliner.

hook.text: In 1963, Kennedy stood at the Berlin Wall and declared himself a citizen of the besieged city.

buildup.text: West Berlin was an island of democracy surrounded by Soviet-controlled East Germany. Morale was fragile.

discovery.text: Kennedy's words â€” Ich bin ein Berliner â€” told West Berlin and the world that America would not abandon them.

twist.text: The line was in German. Speaking the audience's language, even imperfectly, created emotional connection instantly.

climax.text: The speech didn't change policy. But it changed morale. Sometimes that's what a city under siege needs most.

punchline.text: Four foreign words held a city together.

quiz.question: Why was Kennedy's use of German so effective?
options: Speaking the audience's language created instant emotional connection
